title: Open Application Model Configuration JSON Schema

apiVersion.description: The specific version of the Open Application Model specification in use. This version of the specification covers apiVersions in core.oam.dev/v1alpha1.

kind.description: For an application configuration schematic, must be ApplicationConfiguration.

labels.description: A set of string key/value pairs used as arbitrary labels on this application configuration.

annotations.description: A set of string key/value pairs used as arbitrary annotations on this application configuration.

spec.description: A container for exposing application configuration attributes.

variables.description: Variables that can be referenced in parameter values and properties.

opconfigVariable.description: The Variables section defines variables that may be used elsewhere in the application configuration. The variable section provides a way for an application operator to specify common values that can be substituted into multiple other locations in this configuration (using the [fromVariable(VARNAME)] syntax).

name.description: The parameter's name. Must be unique per configuration.
name.$comment: Some systems have upper bounds for name length. Do we limit here?

applicationScope.description: The scope section defines application scopes that will be created with this application configuration.

name.description: The name of the application scope. Must be unique to the deployment environment.

type.description: The fully-qualified GROUP/VERSION.KIND name of the application scope.

properties.description: The properties attached to this scope.

componentInstance.description: This section defines the instances of components to create with this application configuration.

componentName.description: The name of the component to create an instance of.

instanceName.description: The name of the instance of this component.

parameterValues.description: Overrides of parameters that are exposed by the application scope type defined in 'type'.

traits.description: Specifies the traits to attach to this component instance.

parameterValue.description: Values supplied to parameters that are used to override the parameters exposed by other types.

name.description: The name of the component parameter to provide a value for.
name.$comment: Some systems have upper bounds for name length. Do we limit here?

trait.description: The trait section defines traits that will be used in a component instance.

name.description: The name of the trait instance. Must be unique to the deployment environment.

type.description: The fully-qualified GROUP/VERSION.KIND name of the trait.

properties.description: Overrides of parameters that are exposed by the trait type defined in 'type'.

propertiesObject.description: A properties object (for trait and scope configuration) is an object whose structure is determined by the trait or scope property schema. It may be a simple value, or it may be a complex object.
